metadata.title: CVE-2022-0566 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
It may be possible for an attacker to craft an email message that causes Thunderbird to perform an out-of-bounds write of one byte when processing the message. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.6.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
